bibl.title: Carl Berg v. Henry M. White. Stipulation
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.
In Re Application of Carl Berg, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the United States District Court Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of CARL BERG, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

In the above entitled case it appearing that the petitioner was given leave to amend and the government to demur by December 3, 1918, and the petitioner not wishing to proceed further in this case, it is hereby

STIPULATED AND AGREED, by and between Ralph S.Pierce and Geo. T. Vandeveer, attorneys for the above named petitioner, and United States Attorney Robert C. Saunders attorneyfor respondent Henry M. White, that the writ in the above entitled case may be denied with costs to petitioner, and the petitioner remanded to the custody of the Commissioner of Immigration.
Dated this 10 day of February, A.D. 1919.
